document.heading: Foster Care Goals Act Amendment Act of 1985

history.narrative: Law 6-104, the “Foster Care Goals Act Amendment Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-239, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 14, 1986 and January 28, 1986, respectively. Approved without the signature of the Mayor on February 14, 1986, it was assigned Act No. 6-133 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: D.C. LAW 6 10 4 APR 11 1986 AN ACT D.C. ACT -133 IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA FEB 14 bb To establish goals and reporting requirements regarding children in foster care for more than two years for the fiscal years ending September 30, 1986 and September 30, 1987 and to require annual administrative reviews. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Foster Care Goals Act Amendment Act of 1985 Sec. 2. Section 2 of the Foster Care Goals Act Amendments Act of 1983, effective October 8, 1983 (D.C. Law 5-30; D.C. Code, sec. 3-114.1 is amended as follows a) Subsection (a) is amended as follows: By striking in paragraph (1) the word "and By striking the period in paragraph (2) and inserting a semicolon in its place 3) By adding a new paragraph (3) and (4) to read as follows: Not more than 1,113 children as of September 30, 1986; and Not more than 920 children as of September 1
